title: Did the US begin fighting Germany in WWII because of the Holocaust? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: No. The Allies knew nothing of the holocaust before their troops started over-running the camps. They had heard horror stories coming out of occupied Europe but they discounted them as propaganda, as they did not believe that ANYONE could be that cruel. The Allies knew where all the camps were (they had rail lines running to them) but refused to bomb them because it would kill the internees. It wasn’t until the last two months of the war that they realized the horrors that were going on in the camps. So no, the US was NOT fighting Germany on behalf of the holocaust at all. They flatly refused to believe it.

Short answer: No. Long Answer: US couldn’t care less about the extermination of the Jews as long as it only stayed under the sovereignty of Germany. In fact, US was economically a big ally to Germany in the 30s. US only began fighting Germany when the Nazi party declared war on them after the attack of Pearl Harbor by the Japanese forces. The entirety of WWII wouldn’t have happened if Hitler just stuck to killing Jews only, without invading Poland, which was the main trigger for the start of the war when the British government declared it upon Hitler.

No. The US entered the war on Dec.7,1941 when Japanese planes bombed Pearl Harbor.Subsequently,Nazi Germany decided to support is ally,Imperial Japan,and declared war on the USA on Dec.11,1941.(There was,in fact,already a de-facto naval war in the North Atlantic between the German subs and American surface vessels following FDR’s “shoot on sight” order of Sept.11,1941.) The murder of Europe’s Jews was not a matter of great concern to the American government-or any of the other allied states for that matter.

No. Germany declared war on the US on Dec 11 1941. That was the tipping point that got the US into the war against Germany. Germany declared war on the US. On Dec 11, the goal of exterminating the Jews of Europe had not yet been ordered by Hitler (he did it on December 12) and so it could not yet be a reason for the US’s entry into the war. Substantial knowledge of the ongoing mass murder didn’t begin to leak to the West until later in 1942, after the US was already in the war. The Holocaust is not the reason the US got into the war. There were already numerous reasons pulling the US into the war before that.

No. Absolutely not. A) The Japanese Empire attacked us at Pearl Harbor. B) So we declared war on Japan. C) Then Hitler declared war on the USA. D) Then we declared war on Hitler. No connection to the Holocaust.
No. I have no doubt whatsoever that the Holocaust by itself, in the absence of American-Japanese war, and before an eventual German attack on America, would not have brought the USA into WWII.
